meanings.definition: To treat with spite or malice
meanings.sent1: She spited her neighbor by spreading rumors about her.
meanings.sent2: He spited his former boss by quitting without notice.
meanings.sent3: The cat spited the dog by stealing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm spited the picnic plans by pouring rain all day.
meanings.sent5: The villain spited the hero by revealing his secret identity to the world.

meanings.definition: A feeling of resentment or ill-will
meanings.sent1: Her spited towards her rival was evident in her cold glares.
meanings.sent2: The spited between the two siblings was palpable during the family dinner.
meanings.sent3: The spited in the air was so thick, you could almost touch it.
meanings.sent4: The spited in her heart grew stronger with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The spited in the room was like a heavy cloud, suffocating everyone present.

meanings.definition: An instance of spite or malice
meanings.sent1: His spited towards authority figures often led to trouble.
meanings.sent2: The spited in her actions was clear when she sabotaged the project.
meanings.sent3: The spited of the prank was evident in the mischievous glint in his eyes.
meanings.sent4: The spited of the competition fueled her drive to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The spited of the betrayal lingered in the air long after the incident.
